entry.title: Issue Affecting Reservation Related Webhooks
entry.summary: Sep 21, 14:46 PDT Update - We are actively working to find a solution to this issue. In the meantime, we have backfilled all the missed reservation webhook notifications since September 15. We will post more updates as soon as we have them. Sep 21, 10:51 PDT Identified - We have identified an issue affecting the sending of reservation related webhooks starting on September 15th, we are actively working on it and will post more updates when we have them. This incident does not affect all reservations, only a limited number of them. If you notice that some of your Hosts' reservations webhooks are missing, for example when you accept a make_reservation SAC, but you did not receive a confirmation webhook afterwards, use the GET reservations API to retrieve the reservation status.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Gmail. We will provide more information shortly.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2022-09-07 16:04 and ended at 2022-09-08 06:29 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary:

On 07 September 2022, Google Workspace experienced an issue where the existing and new users, who had Gmail recently enabled for them, between 09:04 US/Pacific and 19:11 US/Pacific had a delay before they were able to access Gmail. To our Workspace customers whose users were impacted, we sincerely apologize – this is not the level of quality and reliability we strive to offer you, and we are taking immediate steps to improve the platform’s availability.

Root Cause:

Workspace uses a roster management and indexing API to easily manage, view users, and manage Access Control List (ACL) based on a list of users. When there is a change in a group membership of a user, the API will send a notification. The notification is then compiled by the compilation engine and the output of the compilation is sent to a backend setting service which is used by different Workspace apps to determine whether an app is enabled for a given user and to provide users with appropriate access to the app.

A recent rollout to the roster management backend database inadvertently introduced an issue which generated unnecessary notification traffic on user computation. When membership changes are made to a large roster, all of its descendants need to be recomputed, generating a lot of backend notifications that need to be recomputed and updated. The trigger for the issue was a membership change request from a large customer which required compilation of a large number of user changes.

This caused rapid compilation of app settings for the same customer in a very short time interval putting excessive load on database partitions holding the relevant data thus creating a hotspot. The hotspotting caused delays in compilation of user settings across Workspace applications.

Remediation and Prevention:

Google engineers were alerted to the issue by internal monitoring on 07 September 2022 at 09:37 US/Pacific and immediately started an investigation. At 11:57 US/Pacific, engineers identified the hotspotting issue and narrowed down the trigger. At 13:05 US/Pacific, engineers began mitigating the hotspotting by manual intervention. By 13:59, the compilation success rate had improved and started processing the backlog. The backlog gradually progressed and completed for all the affected customers at 19:11 US/Pacific resolving the issue.

Google is committed to quickly and continually improving our technology and operations to prevent a future recurrence by taking the following actions:

Enhance the compilation scheduling design for better fairness and isolation of customer requests. Enhance debugging tools so that on-call engineers can quickly identify the issues from compilation logs. Complete rollout to fix the issue with the roster management backend database.

Detailed Description of Impact:

Gmail: Google Workspace users, including newly created users that had Gmail newly enabled for them, between 09:04 US/Pacific and 19:11 US/Pacific on 7 September 2022 experienced a delay before they were able to access Gmail.

Other Workspace apps: Users may have experienced delays in accessing other Workspace apps after those apps were enabled for them. Our analysis did not reveal any noticeable errors for other Workspace apps.

Affected products: Gmail

entry.title: New Calendar interface!
entry.summary:
New!
Good News! At Smily, we are here to help you to Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features. This time the new feature concerns your calendar. After many years of loyal service and in response to many requests, we have overhauled the calendar interface, for aesthetic reasons, of course, but above all to make it more efficient and more intuitive for you. What are the main changes? First of all, we are aware that the calendar is your main tool for managing your bookings. So, to ensure a smooth transition, for the moment we have maintained the old calendar view, so that you can switch easily from one to another. 1- Two different views: Planning and Month We separated the planning and the month views into 2 different sections to have a …

entry.title: Incident: Spreadsheet data added using workflows may be incorrect
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
Starting September 6th, 2022, we identified an issue with the Google Sheet app inside Workflow Builder. This issue caused the app to read the spreadsheet date/time format wrong, inserting the incorrect time value in the timestamp.
We discovered this was due to the app processing the workflow step with a single digit value instead of a double digit value.
Users can continue highlighting the Submission Time column in the spreadsheet and select Format → Number → Custom Number Format and insert: ddd mmm yyyy hh:mm:ss, as a workaround.
We will work to fix this through a bug ticket that has been filed as a result of this incident. Though we have not resolved this issue yet, we will provide further updates through customer support tickets with the impacted users.

entry.title: Delay with Event Processing in All Regions
entry.summary: Sep 15, 15:55 UTC Resolved - From 13:50 - 14:50 UTC, our Engineering team observed issues with event processing in all regions. During this time, users may have experienced delays or failures when attempting to process events, such as creation, deletion, resizing, assigning of Reserved IP's, Snapshots, and other Droplet-based events. Our Engineering team has resolved the issue. As of 14:50 UTC, events should not be delayed and should be successful. We apologize for the inconvenience. If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, please open a support ticket within your account.

Sep 14, 20:45 PDT Investigating - We are currently investigating reports where the PASS_THROUGH_CLEANING_FEE standard fee is not being able to be set via the Pricing Settings API. We will provide updates as soon as we can. We apologise for the inconvenience caused.

entry.title: Incident: Windows Store app users may experience an error when launching Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On September 1st, 2022 from around 6:28 am to September 7th, 2022 around 3:00 pm PDT, some users on the Slack desktop app version 4.28.171 installed via the Windows Store were receiving an error when attempting to connect to Slack.
We determined the cached information typically used to launch the app became corrupted, and subsequently caused the app to not load through a network request, prompting an error instead of re-trying the connection. We then launched a fix that allowed the app to re-attempt a network request, which solved the issue.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues drafting a message that contains a link/hyperlink
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On September 8th, 2022 from around 6:44 AM to 7:10 AM PDT some users on desktop clients experienced issues with drafting their messages and saw unexpected character replacements when links with quotes were used. This was caused by an update that was launched and reverting it fixed the issue for all affected users.

entry.title: [New feature] Brand new Dashboard section to easily manage your daily tasks from Smily 🚀
entry.summary:
New!
Today, we are glad to announce yet a new feature: a brand new Dashboard section that will allow you to easily manage your daily tasks, directly from your Smily account. Here is a sneak peek at what the new Dashboard looks like:
In the past, managing day to day operations may have been complicated. Tasks such as keeping track of payments, approving pending tentatives and others were time consuming. Thanks to the Dashboard, you now have access to the following information: List of pending tentatives: to help you convert them into confirmed bookings, or cancel them to free up the dates in your calendar List of bookings with missing payments: to help you get all your payments on time and never miss a payment again List of arrivals of the day: to help you plan the check-in of your guests List of departures of the day: to help you plan the check-out of your guests You can find more details in the dedicated manual article, and a video guided tour of the new Dashboard section will soon be added there as well. We invite you to explore this new Dashboard, and hope it will help you save time and better manage your daily operations. Some improvements will also be made in the future, such as adding performance metrics to help you manage your business more easily.

author.name: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead

entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From August 31, 2022 at 7:24 PM PDT to September 1, 2022 at 12:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced visual trouble with the Slack interface. Multiple message attachments overlapped, making them inaccessible.
We traced this to a recent code change, which we reversed — resolving trouble for all affected users.

entry.title: Incident: Issues setting up SSO for some users.
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From Monday August 29 at 10:11 AM PDT to Wednesday August 31st at 12:42 PM PDT, some Grid customers were running into errors when configuring SSO settings for their workspaces. Upon investigation, we identified an issue that was resulting in empty SAML configuration files. These empty files triggered the errors seen by users.
Removing the offending file fixed the issue for all affected users.

entry.title: Incident: Mark as Read preferences not being respected
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From August 29, 2022 at 11:26 AM PDT to August 30, 2022 at 3:56 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced issues with their Mark as Read preferences, and intermittent issues loading channel history.
When you view a channel, Slack remembers your last scroll position so we can take you back to the same place. A recent feature update inadvertently bypassed the check for this scroll position, creating the impression that Slack wasn't respecting your Mark as Read preference. Additionally, this incorrectly prevented channel history from loading for some users.
We identified the root cause and rolled this code change back, resolving the issue for all affected customers.

If you continue to experience any issues, please open a support ticket from within your account.

entry.title: [New feature] Manage all your reviews from your BookingSync Account !
entry.summary:
New!
At BookingSync, we are here to make you Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features. This time the new feature concerns the reviews management, you can now manage all your reviews on BookingSync. Yes ! all the reviews posted on the biggest channels : Airbnb, Booking.com plus your direct bookings. When accessing the Reviews section, you will see 2 different sub-menus: Guest Reviews: This section will allow you to see the different reviews posted by the guests for each property, the rating plus the message posted by the guest, if you need more detail you can click on the review, a new page will appear with the Review details, the Booking details, the complete guest review message, and the host review if it’s already posted, and you have the possibility to reply to the review message.
Host Reviews: This section will allow you to evaluate your guest and share a detailed rating and a review message.
For each of these section you will be able to filter the reviews by Rating, Rentals and Source. Please find here the video demo explaining step by step the feature. We invite you to discover all these new features, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your reviews, save more time, and have a better ranking and visibility on the channels ! Don’t hesitate to contact our customer care if you have any questions.

author.name: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team

entry.title: Incident with Actions
entry.summary: Aug 24, 18:26 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 24, 18:09 UTC Update - Actions is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate. Aug 24, 18:09 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are encountering a "Reload required" message
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From August 22, 2022 5:15 PM PDT to August 23, 2022 01:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced a persistent reload prompt when when their user account was converted from a member account to a guest account, even after a reload was completed.
A recent change made to our code resulted in the removal of a mechanism for indicating when a reload dialogue should appear. We have pushed a fix for this problem by reinstating the mechanism to ensure this only occurs for users once.

entry.title: Incident: Trouble loading and sending messages in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On August 23, 2022 between 12:17 PM PDT and 1:32 PM PDT, some customers experienced difficulty with loading Slack and sending messages. This occurred when a group of database servers became overloaded and failed.
We first reduced the load on our infrastructure manually. The issue was then resolved when our automated processes kicked in, replacing the damaged server with a healthy one. While the issue is resolved, we will continue to investigate the root cause to avoid these problems in the future.

entry.title: Issues Loading Listings and Images on Airbnb.com
entry.summary: Aug 23, 15:35 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. If you come across this issue again, don't hesitate to reach out through the Support Portal. Aug 22, 16:10 PDT Monitoring - We have implemented a fix, and are monitoring the results. If you come across this issue, don't hesitate to reach out through the Support Portal. Aug 22, 15:21 PDT Investigating - We are investigating an issue that is preventing some images and listings from loading on Airbnb's homepage on airbnb.com, as well as the ability for Hosts to complete some listings. We will post more updates as soon as we have it.

entry.title: Performance Degradation
entry.summary: Aug 23, 12:25 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Users should no longer experience performance degradation. Aug 22, 17:15 PDT Update - Our engineers are continuing to investigate the root cause of the issue. Currently, we expect the issue to be resolved for all users. Aug 22, 12:01 PDT Investigating - Notion is experiencing degradation in performance and preventing some users from accessing their content. We are currently investigating this issue.
